title: It is interesting to note that when Thomas Paine elaborated a costed, universal old age pension proposal he also argued for young people to receive a lump sum of E15 at the age of 21, both to be paid for by a 10 per cent inheritance tax: see Thomas Paine, `Agrarian Justice (1795)'
The special claims of youth are urged by Bruce Ackerman and Anne Alstott, `Why Stakeholding?' and `Macro Freedom'
